section.title: Setting the Password for the Administrative User
section.para: Red Hat CloudForms Management Engine uses a unique admin user to control all functions in the appliance console and the web-based user interface. After installing the appliance, change the default password of the admin to restrict administrative access to the appliance.
Changing the admin password uses the same process as changing any standard user in the appliance.

step.para: Access your appliance through your web browser and login
In the accordion tree on the left, click on Access Control, then select the Administrator under the Users section. This displays the details for the admin user.
On the details page, select ConfigurationEdit this user from the toolbar.
Enter a new password in the Change Password / Confirm Password fields.
Click Save at the bottom of the page.
Log out of the user interface.
Test your new password by logging into the user interface.
Also test your new password in the appliance console.

section.para: The Red Hat CloudForms Appliance now has a secure admin password. This restricts access to your appliance's administrative functions.
